skill.name: deploy-model
skill.description: Unified Azure OpenAI model deployment skill with intelligent intent-based routing. Handles quick preset deployments, fully customized deployments (version/SKU/capacity/RAI policy), and capacity discovery across regions and projects. USE FOR: deploy model, deploy gpt, create deployment, model deployment, deploy openai model, set up model, provision model, find capacity, check model availability, where can I deploy, best region for model, capacity analysis. DO NOT USE FOR: listing existing deployments (use foundry_models_deployments_list MCP tool), deleting deployments, agent creation (use agent/create), project creation (use project/create).
skill.summary: Unified Azure OpenAI model deployment skill with intelligent intent-based routing. Handles quick preset deployments, fully customized deployments, and capacity discovery across regions and projects.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: Static analysis flagged 475 potential issues, but evaluation confirms these are false positives or expected behavior. The skill uses shell commands to invoke Azure CLI for model deployment operations, which is legitimate for Azure tooling. Network access is to Azure API endpoints. Filesystem patterns are documentation examples, not vulnerabilities. This is an official Microsoft skill for Azure Foundry.

low_findings.title: Shell Command Execution in Scripts
low_findings.description: Scripts use shell commands to invoke Azure CLI for model deployment. This is expected behavior for an Azure deployment skill.

low_findings.title: Network Access to Azure Endpoints
low_findings.description: Scripts make network requests to Azure API endpoints. This is required for Azure model deployment operations.

low_findings.title: Documentation References to File Paths
low_findings.description: Documentation files contain example paths. These are documentation examples, not actual filesystem vulnerabilities.

content.value_statement: Deploy OpenAI models to Azure Foundry with intelligent routing. This skill handles preset deployments, custom configurations, and capacity discovery across Azure regions.
actual_capabilities: Deploy OpenAI models using quick preset configurations
Deploy models with custom settings (version, SKU, capacity, RAI policies)
Discover available capacity across Azure regions and projects
Query model availability in specific regions
Generate deployment URLs for Azure resources
Intelligent intent-based routing between deployment modes
limitations: Requires valid Azure subscription with access to Azure Foundry
Cannot list existing deployments (use dedicated MCP tool)
Cannot delete deployments or manage existing resources
Does not support agent or project creation

use_cases.title: Quick Model Deployment
use_cases.description: Deploy an OpenAI model with default settings for rapid prototyping
use_cases.target_user: Developers who need quick access to AI models

use_cases.title: Custom Enterprise Deployment
use_cases.description: Configure deployment with specific SKU, capacity, and RAI policies for production
use_cases.target_user: Enterprise users with specific compliance requirements

use_cases.title: Capacity Discovery
use_cases.description: Find available regions and capacity for specific model types before deployment

prompt_templates.title: Quick Deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy gpt-4o to Azure Foundry in the eastus region
prompt_templates.scenario: Basic model deployment with preset configuration

prompt_templates.title: Custom Deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy gpt-4 with Standard SKU, 100 TPM capacity, and content filtering enabled to westus2

prompt_templates.title: Find Capacity
prompt_templates.prompt: Find where I can deploy gpt-4o-mini with at least 50 TPM capacity

prompt_templates.title: Deployment Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the best regions for deploying gpt-4 with high capacity

best_practices: Always verify capacity availability before deploying in production
Use descriptive deployment names for easier management
Configure RAI policies appropriate for your use case
Store deployment URLs securely for reference
anti_patterns: Do not use for listing existing deployments (use foundry_models_deployments_list)
Do not use for deleting resources (use dedicated Azure tools)
Do not assume all regions have equal capacity
Avoid deploying without checking availability first

faq.question: What Azure permissions are required to use this skill?
faq.answer: You need Azure Foundry contributor access or higher to deploy models.

faq.question: Can this skill delete existing deployments?
faq.answer: No, this skill is for deployment creation only. Use Azure portal or dedicated tools for management.

faq.question: How do I check deployment status?
faq.answer: The skill returns deployment status after creation. Use Azure portal or MCP tools for ongoing monitoring.

faq.question: What regions are supported?
faq.answer: All Azure regions that support Azure OpenAI service are supported.

faq.question: Can I deploy multiple models at once?
faq.answer: The skill handles one deployment request at a time. Repeat the command for multiple models.

faq.question: What happens if capacity is unavailable?
faq.answer: The skill will report unavailable regions. Use capacity discovery to find viable alternatives.
